oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Police cars and officers in front of War Memorial Building in Nashville, Tennessee, circa 1935
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This photograph, circa 1935, features a fleet of Nashville Police cars and officers in front of the War Memorial Building in Nashville, Tennessee. According to the 1935 Nashville City Directory: "Nashville has one of the most competent police departments of any city of its size in the country. This department is under the direct supervision of the mayor and is headed by a chief of police who has under his supervision 208 paid employees." Forms part of the Nashville Room Historic Photographs Collection. 1 photograph : b & w ; 8 x 10 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: War Memorial Building (Nashville, Tenn.)
Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville (Tenn.)-- Buildings, structures, etc.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wiles (Photographer)
